Description: Handle-plate sherd of North Ionian pottery column-krater; cream-buff slip, underside and edges of plate glazed; hook maeander band on rim, running left; tongues on handle-plate; red and white stripes on the interior surface of handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the shape compare: Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 118, no. 968. For a parallel from Naukratis, see Bristol H2016.03 Joins Oxford 1912.35.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IId, pl. 4, 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.476)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
